metadata.title: CVE-2014-0132 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.description:
The SASL authentication functionality in 389 Directory Server before1.2.11.26 allows remote authenticated users to connect as an arbitrary userand gain privileges via the authzid parameter in a SASL/GSSAPI bind.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0132` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

389-ds - 1.3.2.16-0ubuntu1
389-ds-base - 1.3.2.16-0ubuntu1
389-ds-base-libs - 1.3.2.16-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: 389-ds-base package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.2.16-0ubuntu1').
